The subject of this book is a type of machine that comes closer to being a brain that thinks than any machine ever did before 1940. These new machines are called sometimes mechanical brains and sometimes sequence-controlled calculators and sometimes by other names*.

*swearwords https://twitter.com/gutenberg_new/status/1570236013209067522

_list._blog_post_body: As secrecy is the very soul of diplomacy, the art of writing letters in cipher has been invented in order to disguise the written message, but unless the cipher is unusually clever the industry of men, whose wits are sharpened by necessity will not fail to discover the key to it. https://twitter.com/gutenberg_new/status/1570054806966009856

_list._blog_post_body:
There are three Daves.

Hairy Dave, Fat Dave and Short Dave.

Hairy Dave is bald.

Fat Dave is gaunt.

Short Dave is technically short but only when compared to the other two Daves.

This is why we are not allowed to name kings anymore and had to switch to a numerical system.

_list._blog_post_body:
{title}

Download GCODE file Download STL file Download BLEND file

Card stands like these seem hard to buy if you want a certain size or shape or color. Mostly there seems to only be one style available at a reasonable price at any one time. So I just made one I could print and tweak :)

This has a V shaped crevice the bottom part of which clamps and holds onto playing cards. You might need to tweak this blend file as I just did it by trial and error with the minimum distance apart I could get away with printing before it stuck together and that took a fair few tries.

It should print OK without any supports and in batches as it is laying on its side with each layer exactly the same.

I've included a gcode as how its sliced is pretty important for the grip and fit. This works with my default ender 3 pro and generic PLA.
_list._blog_post_body_one:
{_blog_post_older:link_older_post||} {_blog_post_newer:link_newer_post||}
{_blog_post_body}
{_blog_post_older:link_older_post||} {_blog_post_newer:link_newer_post||}
_list._blog_post_icon_wrap: Click to read more...
_list._body:
2022-09-13

3DPrint Game Card Stand

Download GCODE file Download STL file Download BLEND file

Card stands like these seem hard to buy if you want a certain size or shape or color. Mostly there seems to only be one style available at a reasonable price at any one time. So I just made one I could print and tweak :)

This has a V shaped crevice the bottom part of which clamps and holds onto playing cards. You might need to tweak this blend file as I just did it by trial and error with the minimum distance apart I could get away with printing before it stuck together and that took a fair few tries.

It should print OK without any supports and in batches as it is laying on its side with each layer exactly the same.

I've included a gcode as how its sliced is pretty important for the grip and fit. This works with my default ender 3 pro and generic PLA.

https://twitter.com/PuttyCAD/status/1567220685751164932 @PuttyCAD That makes no sense!

Dinosaurs live on the ground.

Birds live in the sky.

So birds must have ASCENDED from dinosaurs.

QED
